image.altText: Police tape across a street with a number of police cars and people in forensic suits standing next to police vehicles.

props.synopsis: The bodies of a woman in her 50s and a girl believed to be in her teens have been found inside a home in Sydney's north-west. Sources have told the ABC that investigators are uncertain of the circumstances of the deaths of the mother and daughter.

title.children: Bodies of woman and girl found in Sydney home

image.altText: Side portrait of woman with pink and purple hair, wearing a leopard print top.

props.synopsis: Over 13 years NSW authorities received 56 reports about the welfare of Sally. She wants her story to be heard so no other little girl suffers in the same way.

title.children: Abused since age 3, it took more than 50 departmental reports and 10 years to remove Sally from that home

image.altText: Greyhounds racing.

props.synopsis: Earlier this week, a "handover report" into Greyhound Racing NSW alleged poor animal welfare. Now an independent inquiry will look into the state's racing body.

title.children: Inquiry with 'wide-ranging powers' to investigate NSW greyhound racing industry

image.altText: A close up of Joe Biden speaking passionately and pointing with his right hand

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden is facing fresh doubts about his re-election chances from heavyweights Nancy Pelosi and George Clooney, and analysts say it's likely he'll give into the pressure.

title.children: 'He'll keep digging his heels in until he doesn't': Pressure mounts on Biden to step aside

image.altText: Police and fire inspectors outside a burnt-out home.

props.synopsis: The 28-year-old man remains in hospital under police guard after being charged with multiple counts of domestic violence murder.

title.children: Man accused of murdering three children in house fire awake and 'understands' charges

image.altText: A pink, furless joey the size of a jellybean can be seen as a gloved hand checks inside the pouch of a wallaby

props.synopsis: The tiny new brush-tailed rock wallaby arrivals were discovered by elated rangers during an annual check as part of a breeding program at the Barrington Wildlife Sanctuary on the New South Wales Mid North Coast.

title.children: 'Phenomenal news': Rangers find six surprise joeys in pouches of endangered rock wallabies

image.altText: Two police officers in tactical gear stand on a street with their backs to the camera

props.synopsis: A magistrate deals a fresh blow to a "weak" Commonwealth case against a suspected Sydney terrorism network, describing an alleged terror plan as "all talk" as he grants bail to a fourth teenager.

title.children: 'All talk': Court grants bail to another alleged terror plotter, branding Crown case 'weak'

image.altText: Two small children are sitting on a couch in colourful pajamas, watching cartoons on their tablets.

props.synopsis: Distraught children are being treated at emergency departments after their parents have pulled the plug on their devices, according to health and education authorities promoting the benefits of a digital detox.

title.children: Parents urged to ditch 'digital cocaine' devices as aggressive children taken to hospital

image.altText: A middle aged white man and a woman with dark curly hair pose by a round port door inside a space station

props.synopsis: A pair of US astronauts who should have been back on Earth weeks ago say they are confident that the problem-plagued Boeing Starliner capsule they rode up on can return them safely.

title.children: Astronauts stuck in space for over a month 'confident' Boeing's Starliner will bring them home

image.altText: NATO

props.synopsis: The newly elected UK prime minister shares the international podium with his European partners and meets with Joe Biden in the White House after promising to continue backing Ukraine in its fight against Russia.

title.children: Starmer draws on NATO values to 'defeat fascism' in first appearance on world stage

image.altText: mccormack bettles

props.synopsis: An Australian executive has severe head injuries and is in a US hospital after a mysterious disappearance on a work trip.

title.children: Australian executive located in ICU after four-day disappearance in US

image.altText: A young couple pose, the man has his arm around the woman's waist

props.synopsis: A quarter of Australia's homeless are young people. While Chloe Hume and Trent Kiely are among them, a caravan by a river has offered them refuge from housing stress.

title.children: Young couple find shelter in a caravan after being left homeless in cut-throat rental market

image.altText: A photo of an empty street in Alice Springs.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has announced the Alice Springs curfew will not be extended, following a request from the police commissioner.

title.children: No extension to Alice Springs curfew, NT government announces

image.altText: Casey Dellacqua and Ash Barty playing together at 2024 Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Alex de Minaur's withdrawal from Wimbledon leaves Australian fans shattered, but Ash Barty is convinced brighter days are ahead for her compatriot, even if he is forced to miss the Paris Olympics. Here are the five quick hits from day 10 at Wimbledon.

title.children: Five quick hits: Ash Barty returns to Wimbledon on sad day for Aussie tilt as Alex de Minaur's Olympic dreams look shot

image.altText: Joe Biden, George Clooney, Julia Roberts and Barack Obama stand side-by-side.

props.synopsis: Just a few weeks after helping the president raise tens of millions at an LA fundraiser, George Clooney is calling on Joe Biden to step aside. It's deeply damaging on several fronts.

title.children: George Clooney's message to Biden is deeply damaging on several fronts

image.altText: An embossed metal sign on a building that reads "Department of Education".

props.synopsis: A "psychopathic" paedophile, who later boasted of sexually abusing 2,000 boys, was employed as a Victorian Education Department school teacher despite declaring in a 1970s job application form that he was a convicted child abuser.

title.children: 'Psychopathic' paedophile was given teaching job despite declaring abuse conviction on application

image.altText: Australian tennis player Alex de Minaur, wearing a black hoodie, sits slumped during a press conference at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: As Alex de Minaur sat and spoke about the dangers of sliding on grass, he had an inkling his Wimbledon campaign might have been ended by doing just that.

title.children: The painfully prophetic words that came back to haunt Alex de Minaur

image.altText: Silhouette of man in front of green screen displaying a Linux command window.

props.synopsis: Australia's cyber intelligence agency says a Chinese government-backed hacking group known as APT 40 has been targeting government and private sector networks here and around the region. But what exactly is an "APT" and what do they do?

title.children: This China-backed hacking group is accused of infiltrating Australian devices

image.altText: Lorraine pulling a dance move wearing a birthday sash

props.synopsis: Lorraine Kaemphel joined an adult tap class when she was 70. Now almost 100, she is inspiring other seniors to take up dancing for fun and friendship.

title.children: Tap dancer, 99, inspires classmates with determination to keep doing what she loves

image.altText: MDMA tablet

props.synopsis: The Australian Criminal Intelligence Commission has revealed Australia's use of cocaine, methylamphetamine and nicotine is on the up, but cannabis remains the illicit drug of choice.

title.children: Report lifts the lid on what drugs Australians used over the Christmas period

image.altText: Older lady sits at kitchen table with a mug in front of her

props.synopsis: The signs of malnutrition in older Australians might be more familiar than you think but they are often dismissed as a 'normal' part of ageing. Here's how some simple changes could help.

title.children: 'Don't skip dessert, have the ice cream': Why older people need more high-energy food than younger folk

image.altText: An older bald man in a suit walks solemnly on a sunny winter's day, surrounded by people

props.synopsis: Over the weekend Jimmy Maladina, who has been on conditional bail following the arrest, issued a statement saying he was fully cooperating with authorities and temporarily stepped aside as a minister while the matter is dealt with by the courts.

title.children: Sidelined PNG minister pleads not guilty to allegedly assaulting woman in Sydney

image.altText: Black plumes of smoke rise from a factory fire in suburban Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Environmental groups are warning of potential health implications for people in Melbourne's west after a huge factory fire in Derrimut. Fire crews are expected to remain at the site for days.

title.children: Melbourne factory gutted by explosive blaze was recently put on notice by watchdog

image.altText: Alec Baldwin in a suit holding hand of Hilaria Baldwin walking towards the camera, journalist to the side

props.synopsis: The defence and prosecution have presented distinctly different scenarios while delivering opening statements in Alec Baldwin's involuntary manslaughter trial in the shooting death of Halyna Hutchins on the set of the film Rust.

title.children: Alec Baldwin's trial begins into shooting death of Halyna Hutchins on Rust set

image.altText: Anthony Carroll takes a selfie by the water with his wife on a sunny day, boats and a wharf in the background.

props.synopsis: Helping people is at the core of what Bondi Rescue's Anthony "Harries" Carroll does. It's this very passion that drives a physically active approach to "unwinding".

title.children: Bondi lifeguard Anthony Carroll on why physical activity helps him unwind

image.altText: Gareth Southgate screams

props.synopsis: After deflecting poisonous criticism for England's style of play, Gareth Southgate answered his critics in the best possible way, as his team finally showed the flare their supporters demanded, combined with the grit that he has shown his whole career.

title.children: From 's***' to Euro 2024 finalists, Gareth Southgate deflects criticism to lead the Three Lions towards glory

image.altText: A stylised image shows an identikit face of an older man over a corkboard background

props.synopsis: Today marks 30 years since the body of a tall, well-dressed man was pulled from the waters off Germany. Investigators hope tip-offs from Australia and genetic mapping may help crack the case.

title.children: This man's identity has been a mystery for 30 years. Investigators want your help to solve the case

image.altText: Bird's eye view of woman looking at an ultrasound scan photo while gently touching her baby bump.

props.synopsis: Australians are increasingly storing eggs and embryos but some clinics are running out of space. As the industry grows, what are the options?

title.children: 'Storage isn't limitless': As more Australians freeze their eggs, how are fertility clinics preparing for the future?

image.altText: Danielle Wood productivity commission

props.synopsis: Most Australians are economically better off than their parents when at a similar age, but that's increasingly not the case for those in poverty, women, and people born after 1990, according to the Productivity Commission.

title.children: Most of Gen X are earning more than their parents, but the picture is cloudy for Gens Y and Z

image.altText: A man and woman, with their baby in a pram, looking at the ASX stock market boards in Sydney.

props.synopsis: We've gone on a deep dive after the stocks of Telix and Select Harvests both rose suddenly on the ASX today. Meanwhile, the overall market is up, after another rally on Wall Street. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: Almond company and nuclear medicine maker both soaring on the ASX today

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Why another little known stock is going.... nuts
Why a lesser known stock is soaring on the ASX today
The Good Guys in court over allegedly misleading store credit promotions

image.altText: A drag queen with an afro, hands to her cheeks. Faded behind her are photos of her in drag and out

props.synopsis: Ahead of her nationwide stand-up tour, the RuPaul's Drag Race winner talks Madonna, Adelaide, JoJo Siwa, TikTok and more.

title.children: What Bob the Drag Queen has learned from working alongside Madonna
